intro: Lamium affine, commonly known as dead nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pale purple or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and gardens. It has a creeping growth habit with square stems and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Lamium affine is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat ailments such as wounds and skin irritations.
